posts.post_content:
The card is good without it, but the seven mana flashback seems pretty steep. I'm sure some decks won't even try to pay it.  
  
I'm hoping this will be good for the U/R combo decks in Modern. Losing [Preordain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Preordain) and [Ponder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ponder) was sort of unfortunate for them.

posts.post_content:
I played against someone who was addicted to this card. He just kept casting it, digging and digging, over and over again. He would sometimes even just dig for another Forbidden Alchemy, just so he could dig again. Then, once he was done casting it normally, he started flashbacking them, either through its own cost or with [snapcaster mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=snapcaster mage).  
  
I feel a little sorry for him. I don't think he ever found what he was looking for, because he ended up milling himself to death.  
  
It was an odd game.

posts.post_content: Even if you don't want to put cards into your graveyard, this card is an instant speed Draw 4 Cards, Discard 3 Cards. That's fantastic, as it allows you to keep mana open, and allows you to dig deep into your library (well, relatively deep -- in my 350 card deck, it's not so deep, but you get the point). It's a [Foresee](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Foresee ) that sacrifices the extra draw for costing 1 less mana and being instant. [Lat-Nam's Legacy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lat-Nam's Legacy) and [See Beyond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=See Beyond) still have their place though ;-)
posts.html:
Even if you don't want to put cards into your graveyard, this card is an instant speed Draw 4 Cards, Discard 3 Cards. It's a Foresee that sacrifices the extra draw for costing 1 less mana and being instant. Lat-Nam's Legacy and See Beyond still have their place though ;-)

posts.post_content:
This thing gets more powerful as your library becomes more diminished. This concept was what gave a previous opponent the chance to turn a game around that I was winning.  
  
First he used Forbidden Alchemy, picking up another forbidden alchemy, then used that and picked up a [ponder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=ponder), then used that and FINALLY came up with something able to deal with my [Grimgrin, Corpse-born](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grimgrin, Corpse-born) (who by this time had become a 2,000,000,000,000,000/2,000,000,000,000,000 thanks to [Rooftop Storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rooftop Storm)/[Gravecrawler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gravecrawler) combo) - [Phantasmal Image](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phantasmal Image). In total he drew 11 cards for 7 mana(!) and kept 3 of them, all of which allowed him to get what he needed =/.  
  
The point is that this thing enables you to draw four cards and keep one of them, and when your library has become significantly smaller, the chance you have more to work with increases. It can become broken beyond broken, especially since the cards you don't keep do n... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
This thing gets more powerful as your library becomes more diminished. This concept was what gave a previous opponent the chance to turn a game around that I was winning.

First he used Forbidden Alchemy, picking up another forbidden alchemy, then used that and picked up a ponder, then used that and FINALLY came up with something able to deal with my Grimgrin, Corpse-born (who by this time had become a 2,000,000,000,000,000/2,000,000,000,000,000 thanks to Rooftop Storm/Gravecrawler combo) - Phantasmal Image. In total he drew 11 cards for 7 mana(!) and kept 3 of them, all of which allowed him to get what he needed =/.

The point is that this thing enables you to draw four cards and keep one of them, and when your library has become significantly smaller, the chance you have more to work with increases. It can become broken beyond broken, especially since the cards you don't keep do n... (see all)

Posted By: Lash_of_Dragonbreath (11/18/2011 5:14:38 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Even without flashback, this would be a fine card. The effect is better in most cases than [Impulse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Impulse), because its easier to mess with your graveyard than the bottom of your library (especially in a set with flashback). Impulse is a pretty good card, so being able to pay 1 more for a slightly better effect is certainly usable.  
  
The flashback is like the flashback on [Firebolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Firebolt). Yeah it's expensive, but it's more like icing on the case for when you have nothing better to spend your mana on rather than the main draw of the card.
posts.html:

Impulse is a pretty good card, so being able to pay 1 more for a slightly better effect is certainly usable.

The flashback is like the flashback on Firebolt. Yeah it's expensive, but it's more like icing on the case for when you have nothing better to spend your mana on rather than the main draw of the card.
